intro: Pedicularis likiangensis subsp. pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. This subspecies is characterized by its striking red and yellow floral display, which attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it forms dense clusters of showy flowers. Its morphology includes slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its native range.
